books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Peter Schweizer
books.description: The author of “Profiles in Corruption” portrays a conspiracy of how the Chinese government might infiltrate American institutions.
books.name: RED-HANDED

books.author: by Bob Odenkirk
books.description: The actor and writer, known for his work in sketch comedy and dramatic roles, charts his path.
books.name: COMEDY COMEDY COMEDY DRAMA

books.author: edited by Nikole Hannah-Jones, Caitlin Roper, Ilena Silverman and Jake Silverstein
books.description: Viewing America’s entanglement with slavery and its legacy, in essays adapted and expanded from The New York Times Magazine.
books.name: THE 1619 PROJECT

books.author: by Frank Bruni
books.description: A New York Times columnist describes his medical journey and shifting priorities after a rare stroke affected his vision.
books.name: THE BEAUTY OF DUSK

books.author: by Arthur C. Brooks
books.description: A columnist for The Atlantic espouses ways to shift priorities and habits to overcome waning abilities in later life.
books.name: FROM STRENGTH TO STRENGTH

books.author: by Ric Prado
books.description: The Cuban refugee and retired C.I.A. officer depicts his career fighting what he describes as shadow wars for the United States.
books.name: BLACK OPS

books.author: by Erik Larson
books.description: An examination of the leadership of the prime minister Winston Churchill.
books.name: THE SPLENDID AND THE VILE

books.author: by Meghan O'Rourke
books.description: An examination of the rise of chronic illnesses and autoimmune diseases.
books.name: THE INVISIBLE KINGDOM

books.author: by Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.name: EDUCATED

books.author: by Michelle Zauner
books.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.
books.name: CRYING IN H MART

books.author: by Elie Mystal
books.description: The Nation’s legal analyst and justice correspondent posits ways to protect the rights of women and people of color.
books.name: ALLOW ME TO RETORT

books.author: by Harvey Fierstein
books.description: A memoir by the four-time Tony Award–winning actor and playwright.
books.name: I WAS BETTER LAST NIGHT

books.author: by bell hooks
books.description: The late feminist icon explores the causes of a polarized society and the meaning of love.
books.name: ALL ABOUT LOVE

books.author: by Chuck Klosterman
books.description: An overview of the cultural and historical impact of the 1990s.
books.name: THE NINETIES
